dataList.content: We were planning to train Jia Xichun anyway, but… it seems that we are now under an unexpected deadline.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Hey, when you said the LCB was going to help me out… did you guys mean that you were going to publicly humiliate the crap out of me at the assembly?
Ha ha, of course not, Xichun.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Big sister Yuanchun’s an old snake! You’ve just given her thirty days to set the perfect stage for my downfall, to prove to the world once and for all that I’m not qualified at all to be the Family Hierarch!
But Xichun, weren’t you always so good at humbling anyone who dared underestimate you?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: ... Not so much anymore.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Back then, like an idiot, I thought I just had to hold on with everything I had. I thought that's all I ever had to do. But now...
But now?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Now…

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Things are different.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: It’s true that I’m vastly underqualified to be the Family Hierarch, and… she’s right. I pretty much lucked into this position.
Xichun, don’t tell me that woman’s bullshit actually got to you?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: ... Well. She wasn't completely wrong, right...?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I’m just some kid who happened to be just good enough to survive some traps and ambushes. I'm afraid that the responsibility of a Family Hierarch might be... too much.
Her self-confidence has significantly decreased compared to the observation from our previous interaction.
The heck, Xichun? I don't remember you being this kinda character!
What happened to the girl who looked down on us the moment we met? Ya even had the audacity to pretend to not know who we were, didn’tcha? Where’d all that confidence go, girl?
<That actually got under her skin back then, huh...?>
So, Xichun. What do you want to do?
Are you sure you’re okay with this? Are you okay with letting this happen?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: If I let it happen...

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: … big sister Yuanchun’s going to continue expanding her influence here.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I’m sure she and the board of directors have been cozying up to each other for a long time.
Is the implication that her testaments on her influence were true?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Yep, it's true. Before she left for Q Corp., big sister Yuanchun used to always accompany Jia Mu to these assemblies.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: If we just let them hold the vote of no confidence, they’re going to unanimously vote against me and slowly reduce the Family Hierarch’s scope of power. And… who knows, they might even call for a re-evaluation, however unlikely that sounds.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Besides, big sister Yuanchun, she… I think her definition of "Hongyuan's prosperity" might be different from mine.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: What she’s looking for isn’t H Corp.’s prosperity, it’s Daguanyuan’s.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: And I know that this all has something to do with its ties to Q Corp., which, I bet, has already been going on for a while just under my radar. I’m sure they’ve already had plenty of talks behind my back.
Which is not the kind of vision you have for Hongyuan’s future, right? And that’s why you spoke up against her?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: My vision for Hongyuan is…

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I want to change H Corp. to be the kind of place where people can live without fear.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I just never imagined I'd have to prove myself like this, and in only thirty days…
Even then, your vision hasn't changed, right?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: … It hasn’t.
Great, great~ So it’s decided then, huh?
We just need Fau to deliver the bad news to Saude.
So, to summarize…

... the responsibility of training Xichun to win these matches… I mean, these amorphous “tests”—upon which hinges the Family Hierarch’s fate, and almost every facet of which is entirely under Jia Yuanchun’s control, by the way, and is probably a trap—within the next thirty days is ours…
… and we have to explain that to Saude.
Ha ha, wow. That sounds like a lot of work when ya put it like that~
Postmortem reports have become quite rote.
Sometime later…
Prithee, thou must impress upon the illustrious Red Gaze that ‘twasn’t mine idea this time…
... Sinclair stared blankly at Don Quixote as she made her desperate plea toward Saude.
Yes, and I understand that as well. For the eighth time.
As always, Saude was wearing the same refreshingly incomprehensible smile.
The kind of smile that makes people increasingly anxious the longer it lasts.
Well, that gives us about thirty days. During which those sparring matches—tests, whatever—will be happening as well… Great. Then let’s give it our best.
Sinclair mutters in a near whisper, clearly feeling responsible for what happened.
Yes, I understand… I never should’ve stepped out of line like that, but something just—
Yeah. So let’s give it our best?
I totally agree… we messed everything up again… and… what? What?!
Limbus Company was always going to remain here and assist Miss Jia Xichun acclimatize herself to the responsibilities of the Family Hierarch. It was always a part of our plan.

Well, I sure am glad that I took Faust’s advice about how meticulous planning is completely pointless when it comes to LCB's missions. I never would’ve had to submit nine separate disciplinary incident reports back during the J Corp. incident, had I known.
Hm.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: I believe I should be able to explain this further.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: Prior to his departure, my lord was concerned that such a thing would come to pass.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: That is why he has left Zilu and I here to look after the new Family Hierarch’s position, which must still be on rather thin ice.
<Ohh, so that’s what they were privately talking about when he pulled them aside… >

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: Doing nothing and allowing her wicked machinations to progress would have irrevocably made the entire board of directors naught but putty in Yuanchun's hands.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: And that would have led that snake to de facto assume the seat of the Family Hierarch…

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: Against such an insidious foe who wields intrigue as her weapon, the most viable strategy is the most direct one: to challenge her head-on.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: Besides, has this not given you the excuse you needed to prolong your company's stay in Daguanyuan?

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: This is also a prime opportunity for Jia Xichun to further solidify her influence here, depending on the outcome of the vote of no confidence. They have played right into our hands by accepting this deal.
So uh… I don’t want to rain on everyone’s parade, but… are we not even going to consider what might happen if we fail?

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: No, we are not. Because you will not fail, not with us aiding your efforts.
Also… were you serious back there when you said that we were all going to teach Jia Xichun? All twelve of us?
I won’t object to selecting only a few us with better aptitude to be educators.
Ah, by the way, we already have an established internal hierarchy based on the sum of each of our abilities. Of course, the results weren’t entirely to my satisfaction, due to an unexpected incident…
Miss Outis, that is… a statement mired in narrowed vision rife with factual refractions… I am of the stance that the qualities of a good teacher are defined not by such statistics.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: … So, you must be the one who placed last in that scale.
Uh…
Just don’t say anything, bud. Best not to stand out like a sore thumb…
… I may have… overreacted, then.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: My lord has said that, from the virtuous we may learn to replicate their merits, from the flawed we may learn to avoid their failings; as long as the student is willing to learn, anyone, anything can be a teacher.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: I also, to embrace this teaching, seek from all those who we come across—

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: … Just what in the heavens are you doing?
Aha, I am… preparing… a lesson plan for young Xichun, our Family Hierarch.
Wow, ya sure got on that fast! So what are these yellow wormy things here?
Aha! ‘Tis a star!!! Twinkle-twinkling in its radiance.
Hm. According to this schedule you have prepared, the student would have negative three hours available for sleep. This lesson plan's execution will require cooperation from T Corp.
Gyah! ‘Twould be a mistake most fatal indeed! I shall correct it posthaste!
Zigong was staring at Don Quixote’s expression of her wild artistic merit upon the curriculum with her usual crescent-moon eyes.
Wait, is that... supposed to be Zigong's grimace?

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: Of course… each to their own, I suppose. I need not be shaken by every little thing until we have their actual lesson plans in hand.
Hey, thanks for putting your faith in us, Zigong. We barely have any of that to go around ourselves, so I understand it couldn’t have been easy.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: … You could say that I have learned my lesson.

dataList.title: The Pinky
dataList.content: The recent events have taught me that… the path of learning is truly one without end.
